column4: anyone else completely FRUSTRATED with WIFI connect problems in ubuntu 10.10? router 10 feet away, WIn7 connects no problem, ubuntu sees router with good signal,  wtf is going on??!!
no problems here.  what security has your wifi got
connected wireless in the past with this adapter running 10.04 ... now it just will not connect
did you test with no encryption? not the best plan in the world I know but it would narrow it down
wicd also failed to connect, weirdly giving 'bad password' error    password is correct ... have a Win7 laptop sitting next to me happily connected at 54MPS 100% signal strength
sounds like maybe its trying to use the wrong wpa protocol... should be AES instead of tkip or vice versa.
try changing the encryption to WPA1...
no it is TKIP ,,, what is difference between WPA passphrase and pre-shared key in wicd?  which to choose?
are you sure its trying to connect using tkip tho?   mabye the driver has a bug also...  so try different encryption, and/or try setting up an 'interfaces' file .
I can give you a hand setting up /etc/network/interfaces where you can specify in more detail the options to connect...might work.
